page.title: 13St. John the Evangelist
page.content: Farncombe was a very little village when the church was built. It was built to hold 400 people, but as Farncombe grew more space was needed. So they decided to put another room with doors leading to the front and other doors leading to the Lady's Chapel. The Lady's chapel is a part of the church where they worship St. Mary. There are lots of wooden benches in the church called pews. The priests get people coming to prey every day. The little room in which you walk through to go to the church is called a Narthex or meeting place. On Sunday all childen go into a sound proof room and there is a loudspeaker so that the children can here the service but their noise can't be heard in the church. There are pipes under the church that contain hot water.
